paragraphs.content: Psalm 9
paragraphs.contentHtml: Psalm 9

paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician upon Muth-labben, A Psalm of David.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician upon Muth-labben, A Psalm of David.

paragraphs.content: I will praise thee, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will praise thee, O Lord, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

paragraphs.content: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.

paragraphs.content: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

paragraphs.content: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

paragraphs.content: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

paragraphs.content: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.

paragraphs.content: But the LORD shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But the Lord shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.

paragraphs.content: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

paragraphs.content: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

paragraphs.content: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, Lord, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

paragraphs.content: Sing praises to the LORD, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sing praises to the Lord, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.

paragraphs.content: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.

paragraphs.content: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Have mercy upon me, O Lord; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:

paragraphs.content: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

paragraphs.content: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.

paragraphs.content: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

paragraphs.content: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.

paragraphs.content: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.

paragraphs.content: Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Arise, O Lord; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

paragraphs.content: Put them in fear, O LORD: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Put them in fear, O Lord: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.
